messages.content: ComfyUI-IP_LAP is a custom node for ComfyUI that integrates the IP_LAP project to create audio-driven videos.
What is the purpose of IP_LAP in ComfyUI-IP_LAP?
IP_LAP is used in ComfyUI-IP_LAP to generate videos based on audio input, allowing for the creation of audio-driven videos.
What are the requirements for running ComfyUI-IP_LAP?
To run ComfyUI-IP_LAP, you need to have ffmpeg installed and working in your command line. You also need to download the weights files and place them in the ComfyUI-IP_LAP/weights directory.
Is there a standalone build available for Windows users?
Yes, there is a portable standalone build available for Windows users with Nvidia GPUs and cuda>=11.8. It can be downloaded from the provided link.
Where can I find tutorials on how to use ComfyUI-IP_LAP?
There are two tutorial videos available: a demo video and a full workflow video. The links to these tutorials are provided in the documentation.
How can I join the WeChat group or donate to the project?
The documentation provides QR codes for joining the WeChat group and making donations to support the project.
What projects are credited in the ComfyUI-IP_LAP documentation?
The ComfyUI-IP_LAP documentation credits the NativeSpeakerUI and IP_LAP projects for their contributions.
